embedDescription: Configure the Climate from Space App to embed it in your application. Selected data layers, stories and globe positions are stored by default
projectDescription:
# About the project

The European Space Agency (ESA) [Climate Change Initiative (CCI)](https://climate.esa.int/) programme aims to provide stable, long-term, satellite-based Essential Climate Variable (ECV) data products to the scientific community and general public. Based on Earth Observation (EO) archives that ESA together with its member states have established over the last 30 years, the CCI programme adds significant and timely contributions to the ECV databases required by United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change ([UNFCCC](https://unfccc.int/)).

ESA's Climate Change initiative is organised in different themes:
- Development of Essential Climate Variables
-- Cross-ECV scientific exploitation of the data products
- Knowledge Exchange

The objective for Knowledge Exchange activities within CCI is to maximise awareness, access, use
and understanding of satellite data for climate research with an emphasis on promoting the CCI
Programme as a whole.

The role of the Climate from Space application (this application) within those objectives is to increase the visibility of the CCI programme and the role of ESA satellite data in climate science. It addresses a general public and educational audience as well as representing ESA climate office at exhibition environments.

# Credits

## Software Development
[Ubilabs GmbH](https://ubilabs.net/)

Team:

Mirko Hamann  
Martin Kleppe  
Jens Wille  
Annika van Lengen  
Patrick Mast  

## Story Content
produced by Planetary Visions  
[www.planetaryvisions.com](http://planetaryvisions.com/) 

Producer: Philip Eales  
Writers: Fulvio Marelli, Catherine Fitzsimons, Philip Eales  
Animation: David Jacobs, Andrew Wayne  
Interviews: Kelsea Brennen-Wessels, Robert Meisner  
ESA Project Management: Sophie Hebden, Ed Pechorro, Susanne Mecklenburg  
ESA Climate Office, ESA-ECSAT, Harwell, UK  

With thanks to the CCI science teams.


## Pictures

Picture sources are credited in their captions.  
Story opening pictures are from:

Planetary Heat Pumps: Andrew Price  
Is Ozone Good or Bad?: NASA-JSC  
Breaking the Ice: ESA  
A Country Under Threat: Museon  
Biodiversity and Habitat Loss: Thinkstock  
Taking the Pulse of the Planet: ESA  

Background maps Copyright © 2020 Planetary Visions Limited, based on: GMTED2010 digital terrain  
(USGS/NGA), HydroSHEDS rivers (USGS), ESA CCI Land Cover water bodies, permanent snow and  
ice (UCL), Natural Earth international boundaries and coastline (naturalearthdata.com).
cookieConsent.title: Your Privacy on the Climate from Space Platform
cookieConsent.message: We use cookies to make this site work properly and to improve your experience. Necessary cookies are essential for the website to function (for example, to remember your privacy settings).
cookieConsent.details: Analytics cookies (Matomo) help us understand how visitors use the site so we can improve it — we only use these if you agree. Media cookies (YouTube) enable embedded videos; they are set only if you choose to view such content. You can accept or reject optional cookies now, and change your choice at any time through the "Privacy Settings" link in the menu. For more details, please see our Privacy Policy.
cookieConsent.preferences.title: Cookie Preferences
cookieConsent.preferences.intro: Choose which cookies you want to allow. You can change these settings at any time.
cookieConsent.category.necessary.descrip: These cookies are required for basic website operation and cannot be disabled.
cookieConsent.category.analytics.descrip: Used to collect anonymised information about site usage. Helps us improve our content and services.
cookieConsent.category.media.description: Enables playback of embedded YouTube videos. When enabled, YouTube may collect data according to its privacy policy.
previewTitle: Copy link to allow anyone to preview
youTube.consentRequired: To view YouTube videos, please enable media cookies in your privacy settings.
